meanings.definition: Compels obedience or compliance with a rule or law.
meanings.sent1: The teacher enforces the school rules to keep everyone safe.
meanings.sent2: The police officer enforces traffic laws to maintain order on the roads.
meanings.sent3: The strict librarian enforces silence in the library, even shushing a noisy fly.
meanings.sent4: The referee enforces the rules of the game like a judge in a courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The security guard enforces the no-entry policy with a watchful eye.

meanings.definition: Carries out or ensures the fulfillment of a requirement or standard.
meanings.sent1: The chef enforces strict hygiene practices in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The quality control team enforces high production standards for the company.
meanings.sent3: The robot enforces its programming flawlessly, never deviating from its tasks.
meanings.sent4: The captain enforces discipline on the ship like a captain steering a ship through rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The manager enforces the dress code with a firm but fair approach.
